svg.style: background: #ffffff; background-color: light-dark(#ffffff, var(--ge-dark-color, #121212)); color-scheme: light dark;

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 348px; height: 1px; padding-top: 33px; margin-left: 23px;
box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 12px; font-family: Arial; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; font-weight: bold; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 10px; font-family: Arial; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

switch.text: Input: GWAS summary statistics (same as C+T)

div.div: Variants in LD share information; shrinkage reduces noise while preserving signal

switch.text: Variants in LD share information; shrinkage reduces noise while preserving signal

div.div: PGS = β̃₁×G₁ + β̃₂×G₂ + ... + β̃₁ₘ×G₁ₘ (all variants, shrunk weights)

switch.text: PGS = β̃₁×G₁ + β̃₂×G₂ + ... + β̃₁ₘ×G₁ₘ (all variants, shrunk weights)

div.style: display: flex; align-items: unsafe center; justify-content: unsafe flex-start; width: 148px; height: 1px; padding-top: 432px; margin-left: 33px;

box-sizing: border-box; font-size: 0; text-align: left; color: #000000;
display: inline-block; font-size: 9px; font-family: Arial; color: light-dark(#000000, #ffffff); line-height: 1.2; pointer-events: all; white-space: normal; word-wrap: normal;

div.div:
• Preserves signal from sub-threshold variants (exploits polygenicity)
• Models LD explicitly rather than discarding correlated information
• Better calibrated for highly polygenic traits like height and psychiatric disorders

switch.text: • Preserves signal from sub-threshold variants (exploits polygenicity)...
